text: Q22. | Consider a relation R(A, B, C, D, E) with the set of functional dependencies {A - BC, CD — E, B-D and E — A}. How many super keys are possible in R? Answer :- 27 Solution: A - BC CD-E B-D E-A Candidate key {A, CD, E, BC} {A}*= {ABCDE} {E}*={ABCDE} {CD}+= {ABCDE} {BC}*={BCDEA} so total super key on R for 5 attribute 25-1=31 B, C, D, BD is not candidate key. 31-4=27 So 27 super key. Answer: 27
